Articles.Content:
I\'ve got a challenge.

Go from Kerbin, to kolar orbit, land on Minmus, then Kerbin, go back to kolar orbit, land on Kerbin, then the Mun and finally back to Kerbin again.

Fastest time wins. If done with stock, your time is halved.

You want a challenge? Here it is. The ultimate test of engineering and piloting skill.

You must provide pics. 'Cheat' parts are not allowed.

Go.

Like Jeb\'s idea in a Mundane Mission?

Slingshot around the Mun the slingshot from Minmus into Kolar orbit, shoot back to Kerbin after a couple orbits, which will take you into a wide orbit, where the long orbit will take you to the Mun.

Oh no. This is:

Get into the sun\'s SOI

Land on Minmus

Land back on Kerbin

Back to the sun\'s SOI

Land on Kerbin again

Land on the Mun

Land on Kerbin the last time.

In that order, no cheat parts.

I think that\'s almost impossible. Maybe if you didn\'t need to land on Kerbin, then take off again, it\'d be possible, but I think that even if this is currently possible, nobody is actually going to try.
The point it that it\'s neigh impossible, unless you are effectively a god at KSP. The challenge stands for all versions, so perhaps when we eventually get docking it\'ll be eaiser? Who knows?
